## Mod.reader() method

Read content for the mod. All content names will be converted into values in the callback. The reader method will return a \[ReadFunction\](readfunction.html) that can be used to read content values.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
reader<T extends ReadonlyArray<Observable>>(...observables: T): ReadFunction<ExtractValueType<T>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  observables | <code>T</code> | A list of requested content. Observables are found in api.document and api.mod |

<b>Returns:</b>

`ReadFunction<ExtractValueType<T>>`

- function used to read content.

## Example 1

Read the dataView once with a callback.

```
let read = api.reader(api.mod.data());
read((dataView) => {
   console.log(dataView.getRowCount());
});

```

## Example 2

Read the dataView each time it changes.

```
let read = api.reader(api.mod.data());
read(function onChange(dataView) {
   console.log(dataView.getRowCount());
   read(onChange);
});

```

## Example 3

Read the dataView and property X each time any of them changes.

```
let read = api.reader(api.mod.data(), api.mod.property("X"));
read(async function onChange(dataView, xValue) {
   let allRows = await mod.plot.getAllRows(dataView);
   console.log(dataView.getRowCount());
   console.log(xValue);
   read(onChange);
});

```

## Example 4

The read function returns a promise with the values if no callback is passed.

```
// The following needs to be done in an async function.
let read = api.reader(api.mod.data(), api.mod.property("X"));
while(true) {
   let [dataView, x] = await read(); // Only resolves when a value has changed.
   console.log(dataView.getRowCount());
   console.log(xValue);
}

```
